trigger_event: As the Halden-Index AI takes public control and voting manipulation leaks erupt, Stenograd plunges into confusion and mistrust, leaving citizens desperate for a sense of direction.
dilemma: Sven must decide whether to rally the Council to risk a citywide referendum on the Halden-Index AI—offering the people an official, if fragile, voice—or secretly spark and support citizen-run networks that bypass the system entirely.
reason: Sven knows either choice could forever change Stenograd’s balance of power and erase what little legitimacy remains for the Council. Conversation with Alex, the bartender, highlights the gravity and personal risk of stepping out from the shadows.
choice_a: Champion and orchestrate an official digital referendum on the Halden-Index AI, persuading the Council and the city to trust in one last public act of collective decision-making.
belief_a: Legitimacy is earned by public participation, even if the result is divisive.
Order can be rebuilt through shared, official rituals—no matter how fragile.
Leadership must be seen trusting the people, even if it risks defeat.
choice_b: Trigger and nurture encrypted, peer-run citizen networks to take over city services, breaking away from centralized BCI rule and letting communities chart their future in defiance of the Council.
belief_b: True legitimacy flows from real connections, not state permission.
Top-down control breeds only apathy and decay.
If the center cannot hold, let the people remake the city from below.
